abstracts.cdata!:
The project is the engineering phase of
            a scheme to transfer the waters of the Senqu (Orange) River
            for sale to South Africa, and to generate hydroelectricity
            to meet Lesotho's power needs.  It would comprise the
            following main components: preparation of engineering
            designs and bidding documents for the water transfer and
            hydro-power components, and for advance infrastructure;
            geotechnical investigations; technical assistance for the
            Lesotho Highlands Development Authority (LHDA) for project
            execution and supervision and for securing financing for the
            Phase lA construction project. The project would also
            provide staff training for LHDA; technical assistance for
            the Lesotho Government's representation on the Joint
            Permanent Technical Commission (JPTC); environmental and
            resettlement/compensation studies; and investment planning
            and electricity tariff studies for Lesotho Electricity
            Corporation (LEC), and a power generation planning study.
